docs.text: Material Repository of a Study on BPMN 2.0-based tools # Here you will find the complete material gathered for the study entitled " A Complementary Analysis of BPMN 2.0-Based Tools Behavior Regarding Process Modeling Problems ", authored by João Vitor de Camargo and advised by Prof. Dr. Lucineia Thom and Msc. Vinicius Dani. On going work All the visual material present in this repository is part of a on going study. This repository is aimed for colleagues and reviewers of our research.
docs.title: Welcome

docs.text: Here you will find the complete material gathered for the study entitled " A Complementary Analysis of BPMN 2.0-Based Tools Behavior Regarding Process Modeling Problems ", authored by João Vitor de Camargo and advised by Prof. Dr. Lucineia Thom and Msc. Vinicius Dani. On going work All the visual material present in this repository is part of a on going study. This repository is aimed for colleagues and reviewers of our research.
docs.title: Material Repository of a Study on BPMN 2.0-based tools

docs.text: Visual Feedback about Problems presented by BPMN 2.0-based tools # Here you will find screenshots and descriptions of visual elements used by 10 process modeling tools to provide feedback about errors. The content of the models is not relevant As the goal is to expose these modeling tools to problems, the content of the models per se is not necessarily relevant. Furthermore, many models were created using labels in portuguese, which should not impact the visual feedback abour problems perceived. Adonis # Used Adonis Community version 11 ARIS # Used ARIS Basic version 10.0.13.1 Bizagi # Used Bizagi Modeler version 3.8.0.191 Blueworks # Used IBM Blueworks Live version June 2021 Bonita # Used Bonita BPM Community version 7.12.1.1 Camunda # Used Camunda Modeler version 4.6.0 Oracle BPM # Used Oracle BPM Studio version 12c QualiBPMN # Used QualiBPMN from May 15 th to May 23 rd of 2021 Signavio # Used Signavio Process Manager Academic version 14.16.0 Visio # Used Visio Microsoft Visio Professional version 2106
docs.title: Visual Feedback about Problems

docs.text: Here you will find screenshots and descriptions of visual elements used by 10 process modeling tools to provide feedback about errors. The content of the models is not relevant As the goal is to expose these modeling tools to problems, the content of the models per se is not necessarily relevant. Furthermore, many models were created using labels in portuguese, which should not impact the visual feedback abour problems perceived.
docs.title: Visual Feedback about Problems presented by BPMN 2.0-based tools
